polysolve package

Submodules

polysolve.solver module

polysolve.solver.cubic(a, b, c, d)

Solve for roots using the cubic formula.

Parameters:

  • a (float) –

    math:

    x**3 coefficient.

  • b (float) –

    math:

    x**2 coefficient.

  • c (float) –

    math:

    x coefficient.

  • d (float) – Constant coefficient.

Returns:

Cubic roots.

Return type:

tuple[float, float, float]

Examples

>>> cubic(1, 0, 0, 0)
  ___________________
| Degenerate MOOoo-ts |
  ===================
                   \
                    \
                      ^__^
                      (oo)\_______
                      (__)\       )\/\
                          ||----w |
                          ||     ||
(0.0, 0j, (-0+0j))
polysolve.solver.quadratic(a, b, c)

Solve for roots using the quadratic formula.

Parameters:

  • a (float) –

    math:

    x**2 coefficient.

  • b (float) –

    math:

    x coefficient.

  • c (float) – Constant coefficient.

Returns:

Quadratic roots.

Return type:

tuple[float, float]

Examples

>>> quadratic(3., 0., -1.)
(0.5773502691896257, -0.5773502691896257)
>>> quadratic(1, 2, 0)
(0.0, -2.0)
>>> quadratic(1, 11, 28)
(-4.0, -7.0)

Module contents

Module to compute quadratic/cubic roots.
